page.title: 09WILCOX AND SONS 4
page.content: Mr Wilcox has a very active mind. When he saw that making saw-mill equipment might be a small market, he invested in the machinery to increase the range of his products. Because one of his sons was involved in {scrambling,}he decided to prove that he could make an{English bike}that was as good as the Japanese make. They designed and built one that was so good that no one who bought one has yet brought it back for repairs or improvement. He could not sell the bikes, though, as his{bank would not {spend enough money on advertising them. He says he will make a better one one day. He showed us the few bikes he has got left, locked in a shed. They are{fantastic. }He is also planning on starting a{timber {yard,}as he has the space and the equipment. He is a{remarkable man.
